title: Unable to launch new client.
body: It was working fine the first several days. Then all of a sudden I got bug splats when I try to start up the client. After re-installing the whole game, I tried to download the beta client but nothing happens. Now when I try to start it I get the message **League of Legends has encountered a problem. Please re-install League alpha client to try again.** But the download link for the new client is missing. How can I resolve this problem?

replies.body:
**Update:** I followed these steps and now the game is patching. I think it's working now, but it's only the legacy client.

- Go to your League of Legends install folder. Default is (C:\Riot Games\League of Legends) go to \RADS\system
- Locate the user.cfg file and open with notepad
- Change leagueClientOptIn = yes to leagueClientOptIn = no
- Save and go to your League install directory and run lol.launcher.exe

I am also having the same problem, But to top it off. I can't download the new alpha client.  I did the steps above and got into the old client, because it kept giving me the same error. (Mind  you I reinstalled 4 times)  of  League of Legends has encountered a problem. Please re-install League alpha client to try again. Now im in the old client, i log in fine. But when I go to the Download link, it wants to uninstall League... What gives?

I see that you're able to get the updated client working now, but it sounds like you have a corrupt install.  Bugsplats usually indicate a bad game file or driver, so I'm worried you might end up crashing after getting into a game.  To be safe, I'd suggest a [reinstall ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) just in case.  Or at least test your game out in a custom game first!  I hope that helps!
